lines.text: I'm not his girl, he's my gangster.
Look at it this way Bo, I'm the one sittin' here, and you're the one sittin' there. Now who would you rather be at this moment?
Count your money and don't let me see it.
I know how much it is.
Good. Now double that in your head and add 3, okay?
Alright.
Alright, now product that by 5.
Product?
...multiply that by 5, subtract 6, and tell me what you come up with.
Just lost 27 cents.
[holds out his hand]
Yeah!
[then suddenly crestfallen]

[about Drew]
She's not like ordinary people. She's not scared of anything.

[about Billy]
Now there goes a kid with luck.
You think Mr. Shultz is an ordinary man, Mrs. Preston, but you're wrong! He's a maniac!
[first lines]

[being tied up]
What do you think, Irving? Makes this cheap dago move on me, Bo Weinberg. The man who took out @Vincent Coll. The man who held Jack Diamond's ears so he could put the gun in his mouth. Who found the rackets he was to *stupid* to find for himself, who made him something more than the lowdown fucking guy that he is! The schmuck, I should expect something else. He pulls me off the the street right in front of my girl, like he don't know no better. Schmuck!
Don't talk to Irving. Talk to me.
Men talk. If they are men they talk. They have disagreement, they discuss these things. But you, I don't know Dutch. I don't know what stickin' womb of puss and scum and ape shit you came out of!
Bo you should understand, I am past the madness part, I am past the anger. Don't waste your breath.
Look at it this way Arthur, you're the one on the lam, and I'm the one on the town. Who would you rather be at this moment, you know what I mean?
You're the first Drew I ever met.
You're the first Dutch.
One of the things about being in a gang is, you gotta follow orders. So far everything they asked me to do, I done it.
Did it.
Don't leave until I get back.
What if I have to pee?
Then I'll bring you back a can.
[last lines]
Kid, you want a ride?
No thanks, I'll walk.
